definition: to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to give a thumbs-up/to express one's approval
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth

sentences.english: The cock (or rooster) bristled his crest.
The horse cocked its ears when it heard the noise.
sentences.chinese: 那馬聽到聲音就豎起了耳朵。

sentences.english: First hold the nail with the wide head by its shaft and push it head-first into the ball of clay.
sentences.chinese: 首先將寬頭釘的杆豎起，將其頭朝下推入橡皮泥球。

sentences.english: He straightened himself up, and rooted himself upon that point of support with a sort of fury.
sentences.chinese: 他豎起身來又彎下去，拚命在這個支點上站穩。

sentences.english: The driver grinned and gave me a thumbs-up sign.
sentences.chinese: 汽車司機會意地咧嘴一笑，向我豎起大拇指。

sentences.english: We usually hold a mirror up to it after it's happened.
sentences.chinese: 我們通常在事件發生之後，爲它豎起一面鏡子。

sentences.english: They feed at or close to the surface with their mouths wide open and gill rakers erect.
sentences.chinese: 姥鯊會在或近水面張開口及豎起鰓耙來攝食。

sentences.english: Under excitement, the dog may carry his tail somewhat higher, but not cocked up.
sentences.chinese: 在興奮時，尾巴可能舉的高一些，但決不能向上豎起。

sentences.english: He cocked an eyebrow for me to explain.
sentences.chinese: 他向我豎起眉毛要求解釋。

sentences.english: Derricks would rise as much as 180 feet above the borehole.
sentences.chinese: 井上可豎起高達180英尺的井架。

sentences.english: The horse pricked up her ears, and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 馬豎起耳朵，向四處張望。

sentences.english: At least three avenues of valid immigration have discerned roadblocks erected.
sentences.chinese: 至少有三條合法移民之路已經豎起了“路障”。

sentences.english: A sudden breeze ruffled the surface of the calm lake.
sentences.chinese: 阿風突然豎起了寧靜的湖面。

sentences.english: It seemed as if overnight an invisible wall had been erected between us.
sentences.chinese: 就好像在一夜之間，我們之間豎起了一堵無形的牆。

sentences.english: The dog's ears perked up when hearing a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 狗聽見有人在敲門，豎起了耳朵。

sentences.english: A darker metallic ruffled bolero completes the look.
sentences.chinese: 深色金屬徹底豎起的波麗的外觀。
